requirements.summary_text: Notify individuals no later than 45 days after determination of breach; notify AG within 45 days if 1,000+ affected
requirements.applies_to: Covered entities that acquire or use sensitive personally identifying information

requirements.summary_text: Civil penalty up to $5,000 per day of noncompliance; maximum $500,000 per breach; AG enforcement only
requirements.applies_to: Covered entities that acquire or use sensitive personally identifying information

requirements.summary_text: Notify in the most expedient time possible, without unreasonable delay; notify AG if 1,000+ affected
requirements.applies_to: Any person that owns or licenses personal information of Alaska residents

requirements.summary_text: Civil penalty up to $500 per resident not notified; maximum $50,000 per breach; AG enforcement under Unfair Trade Practices Act
requirements.applies_to: Any person that owns or licenses personal information of Alaska residents

requirements.summary_text: Notify individuals within 45 days of determination of breach; notify AG within 45 days if 1,000+ affected
requirements.applies_to: Any person that conducts business in Arizona and owns, maintains, or licenses unencrypted personal information

requirements.summary_text: Civil penalty up to $10,000 per breach for knowing/reckless failure to comply; $50,000 per breach for knowing/reckless concealment; AG enforcement under Consumer Fraud Act
requirements.applies_to: Any person that conducts business in Arizona and owns, maintains, or licenses unencrypted personal information

requirements.summary_text: Notify in the most expedient time possible, without unreasonable delay; notify AG if 1,000+ affected
requirements.applies_to: Any person or business that acquires, owns, or licenses computerized data containing personal information
requirements.penalty_max: $10,000 per violation (under Deceptive Trade Practices Act)

requirements.summary_text: Enforced under Deceptive Trade Practices Act; AG may seek injunctive relief and civil penalties up to $10,000 per violation
requirements.applies_to: Any person or business that acquires, owns, or licenses computerized data containing personal information

requirements.summary_text: Notify in the most expedient time possible, without unreasonable delay
requirements.applies_to: Any person or business that owns or licenses computerized personal information

requirements.summary_text: Civil penalties up to $7,500 per intentional violation; $2,500 per unintentional violation under CCPA; statutory damages $100-$750 per consumer per incident
requirements.applies_to: Any person or business that owns or licenses computerized personal information

requirements.summary_text: Notify individuals within 30 days of determination of breach; notify AG within 30 days if 500+ affected
requirements.applies_to: Any individual or commercial entity that maintains, owns, or licenses personal information of Colorado residents

requirements.summary_text: Enforced under Colorado Consumer Protection Act; civil penalty up to $2,000 per violation ($10,000 for elderly); private right of action for actual damages
requirements.applies_to: Any individual or commercial entity that maintains, owns, or licenses personal information of Colorado residents

requirements.summary_text: Notify individuals no later than 60 days after discovery of breach; notify AG within 60 days
requirements.applies_to: Any person that conducts business in Connecticut and owns, licenses, or maintains personal information

requirements.summary_text: Notify in the most expedient time possible, without unreasonable delay; notify AG if breach affects DC residents
requirements.applies_to: Any person or entity that conducts business in DC and owns, licenses, or maintains personal information

requirements.summary_text: Notify no later than 30 days after determination of breach
requirements.applies_to: Covered entities (sole proprietorships, partnerships, corporations, etc.) that acquire, maintain, store, or use personal information

requirements.applies_to: Covered entities (sole proprietorships, partnerships, corporations, etc.) that acquire, maintain, store, or use personal information

requirements.summary_text: Notify in the most expedient time possible, without unreasonable delay; no specific day limit
requirements.applies_to: Any information broker or data collector that maintains computerized data containing personal information

requirements.summary_text: Consumers can request disclosure of categories and specific pieces of personal information collected
requirements.applies_to: Businesses meeting CCPA thresholds: >$25M revenue, 100k+ consumers, or 50%+ revenue from data sales

requirements.summary_text: Consumers can request deletion of personal information; business must also direct service providers and third parties to delete
requirements.applies_to: Businesses meeting CCPA thresholds: >$25M revenue, 100k+ consumers, or 50%+ revenue from data sales

requirements.summary_text: Consumers can opt out of sale or sharing of personal information; 'Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information' link required
requirements.applies_to: Businesses meeting CCPA thresholds: >$25M revenue, 100k+ consumers, or 50%+ revenue from data sales

requirements.summary_text: Consumers can opt out of targeted advertising, sale of personal data, and profiling producing legal or significant effects
requirements.applies_to: Controllers conducting business in Texas or producing products/services consumed by Texas residents; excludes small businesses (SBA definition)
